Comments: Super fun loop to do, very beautiful this time of year! Would definitely recommend for an easy but rewarding hike.
Wonderful hike! Absolutely beautiful views, shady path, wild flowers, butterflies and aspens!

Beautiful. Humid this time of year but a storm rolled in and cooling things down nicely. The hike is moderate as it’s half uphill and then half down hill but love the loop and the view when you get the the end is amazing. Great hike for those interested in a good hike for half day. Took us less than 3 hours even with stopping at the top for a bit and a slow pace uphill.

Bugs. Bugs. and more bugs. Had bug spray but didn’t help much. Too many dirt bikes, hard to enjoy the trail and get into a good hiking pace when you have to constantly get out of their way. Loud and lots of exhaust also detract from the beauty of the trail. Didn’t do the whole loop because we were over it.

Awesome hike. Super easy and gorgeous views. The loop was perfect and the overlook was worth the 10 minutes uphill. It was pretty muddy when we went because of the rainstorm yesterday. The mosquitoes seem to be dying down, they weren’t bad. We went at 7 am and the temperature was perfect. Only saw one group of people although there were crowds arriving as we left around 9.
Bring bug spray!! The mosquitoes were constantly swarming us! Love the variety of this trail, meadows to aspens to pine trees and lots of flowers along the way.

This is such a fun hike. There are a couple of good, steep sections but it’s fairly tame overall. I’ve done the hike three times in the last week as my workout for the day because I live close to AF canyon. Primrose Overlook is stunning right now. The wild flowers are in full bloom. One of the times I did it recently, I took my seven year old daughter and she handled it really well. So I’d say adventurous kids can do this hike no problem. When you start up the trail to the overlook from the meadow, it’s going to get very steep, very fast. This section is quite short though, and the reward is worth the climb. Bug spray is helpful, there are a lot of mosquitos right now.

This trail was definitely hard to follow. The snow covered a good portion of it, it was overgrown in a few spots and it was poorly marked. I definitely got lost a time or two. That being said, this was easily one of the best hikes I’ve been on and the views at the end are incredible!

This is a beautiful trail through aspen trees, and it culminates with a breathtaking view of the surrounding mountains. While a moderate hike, the elevation gain will make for a good little workout. Be sure to wear good shoes, as the trail can be slippery coming down. Probably best to hike this when the wildflowers are in full bloom, or in the fall when the leaves have changed.
Came up the Lame Horse trail because of locked gates in the winter. Snowshoeing to Primrose overlook gets steep.
